title: Pharmacy Students Were Crucial to COVID-19 Testing, Vaccination Efforts
description: Several third-year pharmacy students at the Washington State University College of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences said they were involved with COVID-19 testing and vaccination efforts, including organizing mass vaccination events and testing patients in their communities.
cleaned_text: Several third-year pharmacy students at the Washington State University College of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences said they were involved with COVID-19 testing and vaccination efforts, including organizing mass vaccination events and testing patients in their communities. Several third-year pharmacy students at the Washington State University College of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences said they were involved with COVID-19 testing and vaccination efforts, including organizing mass vaccination events and testing patients in their communities. For example, although he lives further away from the main campus in Spokane, Trevor Schultz said he has gotten involved through his internship position. Schultz said he has worked with his mentor to launch vaccination efforts in his community and added that he volunteered over winter break to get the first clinic up and running.
